title: How ranking system works
body: I recently went 1/0/11 on morgana in a 20 minutes game and the game gave me an A+. I sorta feel cheated out of an S that game because I felt like I played very well but getting an A+ for that sort of game just brings my morale super down. I just wanna know how the ranking system works and if there is no curve for supports or a curve for shorter games cause I feel like this is an issue with the ranking system if that is so.

replies.body: well this aint the ranking system this is the grading system lol. playing meta supports is just generally harder to get S grades, since kills are quite a large factor in grading. Remember the system compares your scores to thousands of other scores of people playing the same champion in the same role. The morganas that got a few more kills and assists woulda got the S rank while your morgana stuck with the A+

Very true. I had level 6 blitz for an aeon, could only get S- or below once i got my 6.
2 support games i had a chance to go full AP, got several kills with my normal death/assist ratio and got x2 S ranks. Then took blitz mid, played passive to late game and scored the rest of my required S to level 7. My mid stats were not vastly impressive, but because i went mid, because i assisted every dragon and baron, S ranks were a shoe-in because my games where compared to mid-blitz games, which im sure are few and far between
It compares your game play (kills/deaths/assists/objectives/etc) with other people that have played Morgana in whatever lane you played...
